alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Hardin; Perry; Wayne (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 05 at 4:48AM CST until further notice by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River At Clifton affecting Perry, Wayne, Decatur and Hardin Counties. For the Tennessee River...including Clifton...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Tennessee River At Clifton. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 366.0 feet, In Hardin County, water inundates low lying agricultural areas and access roads in the Cobb Farm area of Nance Bend, including Senator Cobb Road and Colonel Hardin Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 366.0 feet early Wednesday morning. - Action stage is 364.0 feet. - Flood stage is 370.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM CST.
